text: The deponent will have 30 days to read and sign.
Waive the notary.

text: Got it.  Mr. DeSisto, I am here to take your deposition today.  I'll go over a couple of basic ground rules just for the court reporter's sake. I'll just ask you to let me finish my question before you respond.  And I'll give you the same courtesy, let you finish your answer.  If you don't understand any of my questions, let me know, and I will be happy to repeat or rephrase them.  If you need to take a break at any time, that's fine; but I'll just ask you to answer the last question posed to you before we go off the record.

text: So, nothing changed in the way the ramps were installed after Ms. Mello's fall?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Objection.
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: I don't recall that we did anything differently. I'm not even sure what the date was that we received notice.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Looking at Page B of Exhibit No. 2, do you see that there's a piece of wood in that photograph?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have any idea where that wood came from?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I do not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is there a reason that that wood is there?  Is it somehow structurally part of the ramp?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I don't believe it is.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And again, you think that this is a perfectly fine way to leave the job construction site?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Objection.  Asked and answered.
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: (Photograph marked as Exhibit 6 for Identification.)
Handing you what has been marked as Exhibit No. 6.  Do you recognize what's shown in this photograph?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I do, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: There is some writing, and this came from Google. So, do you see Hyde Park Ave. as shown down the center of the photograph?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: There's a small red icon, and that's 1591 Hyde Park Avenue?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Yes, it is.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is this parking lot to the left of the left side of Hyde Park Avenue, is that the Greene Construction Storage facility?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I believe it is, yup.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And there's a light gray sidewalk that runs from about an inch above the 1591 marker down to right around where it says J&K Auto Repair, is that about right?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that the sidewalk that was the subject of the Hyde Park construction project that we've been talking about?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Yes, it is.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That is my only question for you.  And that's a fair and accurate representation of the aerial view of the sidewalk project?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Objection.  We just don't know when this is from.
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: That is from 2019.
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Oh.
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: Down at the bottom here.
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I can't see that.
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: It says Map 2019.
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: And that would have been when the project was completed, several years after, correct?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Yup.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Are there any other employees of Greene Construction who are responsible for safety?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Objection.  Other than?
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: Other than --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- John Downy, the safety officer.
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: We have a new safety who just recently was hired.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: A new safety director?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Not director.  He's a safety officer, I guess.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How many safety officers does Greene Construction employ?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Two at this point.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Has it always had two, or is the new --
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: -- no.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- officer --
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: -- sorry.  Sorry about that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Has it always had two, or was it just one prior to the hiring of this new employee?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: It was just one prior to hiring him.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Why did Greene decide to employ another safety officer, if you know?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: It's a matter of volume and the amount of work we were doing at the time, we decided to hire another.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you said John Downy is the safety officer in charge of safety, can you be any more specific than that?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Not really.  I mean safety officer in charge of safety.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If employees of Greene Construction do something that is unsafe on the job site, are they disciplined for it?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Objection.  If you know.
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If employees of Greene Construction leave job sites in an unsafe condition, are they disciplined?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Objection.
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: They're spoken to.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: By who?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Depends on who is in charge of the project.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Would it be the project superintendent?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Could be.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So, for the Hyde Park Sidewalk Project, that would have been you?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you speak to any of the staff of Greene Construction about the way the Hyde Park Sidewalk Project was left at any point during construction?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Objection.  Go ahead.
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: I'm sure we spoke.  I don't recall having a specific conversation with anybody regarding --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Would there be a record anywhere of when you speak to an employee about leaving a job site in an unsafe condition?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Objection.  And I don't think he testified that he spoke with somebody about leaving the job site in an unsafe condition.
speaker: MS. BYRON

text: I apologize.  I will ask it again a different way.
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: During your time as site superintendent for the Hyde Park Sidewalk Project, did you ever speak to any of the staff of Greene Construction that was working on that project about leaving the job site in an unsafe condition?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I have no -- I did not, not specifically on that project.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you keep employee files, personnel files?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I would guess that -- I don't know specifically, but I would guess that the company has employee files, yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So, if employees were disciplined for any reason, that would be recorded in their personnel file?
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Those are all the questions I have for you.
speaker: MS. BALDWIN

text: I'm not going to ask you any questions.
speaker: MS. BYRON
